column1: // Quiz 01 — HTML & Basic CSS (Question Bank 2 for Pools)

column2: Which element wraps supplementary content related to the main content?
Think tangential content such as callouts or sidebars.
<aside> is for tangentially related content; it complements the main content.
Which element best represents a set of site navigation links?
Look for the semantic element intended for navigation.
Choose the most accessible and descriptive link text:
Link text should make sense out of context.
Descriptive link text helps all users and screen readers.
Which HTML links to the heading with id="contact" on about.html?
Include the target file and the fragment.
Use filename plus #id to target a section on another page.
Which markup correctly associates an image with a caption?
Caption should be inside the figure element.
Which statement about alt text is correct?

column3: Keep it brief and convey the image’s purpose
Leave alt empty for informative images
Copy the caption into alt text

column2: Good alt text communicates purpose succinctly.
Which CSS centers a fixed-width block container horizontally?
Applies to the container box itself.
margin: 0 auto; centers a block with a defined width.
Which CSS helps maintain comfortable line length for text paragraphs?
70ch is a common starting point for readable line length.
Which rule removes default margins and padding from both html and body?
Target both root and body elements.
Setting both to margin:0; padding:0; is a common reset.
Which selector targets only direct list items inside a nav’s top-level list?
The > combinator selects direct children only.
The <main> element should appear only once per page.
There is one dominant main content area.
<main> is intended for the primary content region.
The meta viewport tag helps pages render well on mobile devices.
Viewport meta controls layout width and scaling on mobile.
The <aside> element is appropriate for tangential info like callouts or sidebars.
Aside holds content related but not central to the main flow.
Use <section> primarily when content can be grouped under a heading.
Best practice: each section has a heading.
Setting box-sizing: border-box; on * is a common reset pattern.
It makes width/height calculations more predictable.
Explain the difference between margin and padding.
Consider whether space is inside or outside the element’s border.
Margin is outside the border; padding is inside.
When is it appropriate to use an empty alt attribute (alt="")?
Think images that convey no information.
Use empty alt for decorative or redundant images so screen readers skip them.
Give one benefit of using max-width with centered content for text blocks.
Consider readability and comfortable line length.
Limiting measure improves readability and user comfort.
What does the <main> element represent on a page?
It should contain the central content unique to the page.
Main holds the primary content unique to the document.
Why should you avoid non-descriptive link text like "click here"?
Think accessibility and understanding out of context.
Non-descriptive links hurt accessibility; text should describe the target.
